precise: if you run:  sudo apt-get update     is it smooth?
and if you run:  sudo apt-get upgrade    is it smooth?
technically, users in the 'sudo' group are admins, they need to be in that group to run admin commands
then it won't work as the standard account, it doesn't have permissions
also run:  gksudo software-center      what is output?
gksudo gedit /usr/share/applications/software-center.desktop      change the Exec= line
reading is useful, you should try it
so you chaned the Exec line in /usr/share/applications/software-center.desktop   (or similar) to:  Exec=gksudo software-center     ?
